Did you know?

We provide budget estimates for venues to help you make an informed decision.

**Budget Estimate Includes:**

  * Venue Rental Costs
  * Food & Beverage Costs
  * Taxes and Other Fees



Our Spot Estimate tool helps plan for a budget that works best for you. Try it by pricing out a venue you like!

**Example: Heritage Hall at Stormont Vail Events Center**

Starting at **$1,558 **for **50** Guests

### Kansas Wedding Venues

There are a variety of beautiful wedding venues available in Kansas. At Wedding Spot, our goal is to provide you with detailed information about Kansas wedding venues to help you make the best choice for your special day.

#### Wedding Venues in Kansas - What to Consider

Our team is especially equipped to supply you with helpful tips and information about wedding venues in Kansas. It starts with where in Kansas you plan to host your wedding. Luckily, Kansas tends to have beautiful scenery no matter where you go. With locations like Kansas City and Wichita, you can’t go wrong with where you choose to host your wedding ceremony and reception.

Once you know what region you plan to host your wedding in, you’ll want to make sure you select the right venue style. It can be challenging to choose your wedding venue style as a variety of factors can go into the decision making process. With Wedding Spot, you have the ability to research and view what different venue styles have to offer, which can help make your decision easier. While each state offers its own styles to choose from, Kansas has plenty to offer. Depending on your state, here are just some examples of the styles you have to choose from:

Banquet Hall / Restaurant

Rustic & Barn

Vintage / Rustic

Outdoor

Beach

You’ll also want to consider the number of guests you plan to invite and how many events you plan to host as this can inform the size of your wedding venue. Some Kansas Wedding Venues are large enough to host the wedding ceremony, reception and rehearsal dinner, whereas some may only be large enough to host 1 or 2 events. Last but certainly not least, another very important aspect of selecting the right wedding venue is budget. Whether you have a budget of $5,000 or $50,000, we can help you explore the pros and cons of multiple Kansas wedding venue price points.
